name: Fried Chicken
description: Juicy, flavorful fried chicken with an easy dredge made by mixing flour and water to a pancake-batter consistency.
gist: Season the chicken, dredge it in a flour-cornstarch-baking powder-spice mixture, and fry at around 375°F until golden brown.
ingredients:
Chicken (any cut or form)
1.5 cups flour
1/2 cup cornstarch
1 tbsp baking powder
All Purpose Seasoning plus salt and cayenne
Water
Neutral oil for frying (vegetable, canola, etc.)
steps:
1. Cut chicken into strips, chunks, or nuggets.
2. Place chicken in a large bowl to prepare the dredge.
3. Season chicken with All Purpose Seasoning, salt, and cayenne.
4. In a separate bowl, combine 1 cup flour, cornstarch, baking powder, additional All Purpose Seasoning, salt, and cayenne. Set aside.
5. In the chicken bowl, combine the remaining 1/2 cup flour with more seasoning. Slowly add water (about 2 tbsp at a time) until the mixture reaches a pancake-batter consistency and sticks to the chicken.
6. One piece at a time, coat the chicken in the first flour mixture, pressing the flour into the surface.
7. Heat oil to 375°F, adjusting for temperature drop when adding chicken.
8. Fry in batches until golden brown and fully cooked, about 5–8 minutes depending on size.
